Race.SpecificTitle: City of Monroe Spec. Sch. Dist. -- $58,800,000 Bonds - SB - 20 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
City of Monroe Special School District Proposition
(Bond)
Race.FullText: Shall the City of Monroe Special School District (the "District"), incur debt and issue bonds not exceeding $58,800,000, in one or more series, to run not exceeding 20 years from the date thereof, with interest at a rate not exceeding 8% per annum, for the purpose of acquiring and/or improving lands for building sites and playgrounds, including construction of necessary sidewalks and streets adjacent thereto; purchasing, erecting and/or improving school buildings and other school related facilities within and for the District, and acquiring the necessary equipment and furnishings therefor, and specifically for those projects in the "Capital Improvement Plan" to be approved by the School Board prior to the election, title to which shall be in the public; which bonds will be general obligations of the District payable from ad valorem taxes to be levied and collected in the manner provided by Article VI, Section 33 of the Constitution of the State of Louisiana of 1974, with no estimated increase in the millage rate to be levied in the first year of issue above the 13.65 mills currently being levied to pay General Obligation Bonds of the District?

Race.SpecificTitle: City of Monroe Prop. #1 -- 1.88 Mills - CC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
City of Monroe Propositions
Proposition No. 1
(Recreation Facilities - Continuation)
Race.FullText: Shall the City of Monroe, State of Louisiana (the "City"), acting under the authority of Article VI, Section 30 and 32 of the Constitution of the State of Louisiana, be authorized to continue to levy a special tax of one and eighty-eight hundredths (1.88) mills tax on all property subject to taxation in the City, said mills to represent a 0.15 mills increase over the 1.73 mills tax authorized to be levied through the year 2013 pursuant to an election held on November 15, 2003 (an estimated $734,445.69 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2014 and ending with the year 2023, for the purpose of maintaining and operating the recreational facilities of the City?

Race.SpecificTitle: City of Monroe Prop. #2 -- 1.06 Mills - CC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
City of Monroe Propositions
Proposition No. 2
(Safety Services - Continuation)
Race.FullText: Shall the City of Monroe, State of Louisiana (the "City"), acting under the authority of Article VI, Section 30 and 32 of the Constitution of the State of Louisiana, be authorized to continue to levy a special tax of one and six hundredths (1.06) mills tax on all property subject to taxation in the City, said mills to represent a 0.08 mills increase over the .98 mills tax authorized to be levied through the year 2013 pursuant to an election held on November 15, 2003 (an estimated $414,102.35 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2014 and ending with the year 2023, for the purpose of providing municipal public safety services in the City and maintaining and operating municipal service departments in connection therewith, including the acquisition of necessary equipment?

Race.SpecificTitle: City of Monroe Prop. #3 -- 1.31 Mills - CC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
City of Monroe Propositions
Proposition No. 3
(Drainage Facilities - Continuation)
Race.FullText: Shall the City of Monroe, State of Louisiana (the "City"), acting under the authority of Article VI, Section 30 and 32 of the Constitution of the State of Louisiana, be authorized to continue to levy a special tax of one and thirty-one hundredths (1.31) mills tax on all property subject to taxation in the City, said mills to represent a 0.10 mills increase over the 1.21 mills tax authorized to be levied through the year 2013 pursuant to an election held on November 15, 2003 (an estimated $511,768.00 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2014 and ending with the year 2023, for the purpose of operating and maintaining drainage facilities of the City?

Race.SpecificTitle: City of Monroe Prop. #4 -- HRC Amend-CC-Term Limits-City Council
Race.SummaryText:
City of Monroe Propositions
Proposition No. 4
(Charter Amendment - Term Limits - City Council)
Race.FullText: Shall the Home Rule Charter and Plan of Government for the City of Monroe, Louisiana, be amended pursuant to Article VI of the Constitution of the State of Louisiana and Article VII, Section 7-04 of the Home Rule Charter of the City of Monroe, by adding Section 2-01G. to the Home Rule Charter of the City of Monroe, Louisiana, to provide that no person shall be eligible for election to the City Council for more than three (3) consecutive terms said term limit to be applied prospectively following the term of the Councilmen elected in the 2012 election?

Race.SpecificTitle: City of Monroe Prop. #5 -- HRC Amend-CC-Term Limits-Mayor
Race.SummaryText:
City of Monroe Propositions
Proposition No. 5
(Charter Amendment - Term Limits - Mayor)
Race.FullText: Shall the Home Rule Charter and Plan of Government for the City of Monroe, Louisiana, be amended pursuant to Article VI of the Constitution of the State of Louisiana and Article VII, Section 7-04 of the Home Rule Charter of the City of Monroe, by adding Section 3-03C. to the Home Rule Charter of the City of Monroe, Louisiana, to provide that no person shall be eligible for election to the Office of Mayor for more than three (3) consecutive terms said term limit to be applied prospectively following the term of the Mayor elected in the 2012 election?
